Description:
Options of Lifestyle or Development in Central Position
This wonderful home is set in a quiet locale just 30 seconds to the hub of town. It also delivers a dramatic parcel of land measuring 3407m2. This attractive allotment grants the family room for fun & games, extensions, further shedding, birdlife and more. The potential developer could consider other avenues (STCA) with a frontage of 59 meters and a second street access. There are lovely views to be had from the property and with the home being set back from the street, a great sense of privacy is had. The abode has a wondrous feel of warmth. Timber features throughout and combustion heating certainly add to the ambiance. All room sizes throughout are very generous taking large suites and the two living rooms can host many guests. These lead out to a vast outdoor entertaining area.
Insights: 18 Harvey Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2017 and 14 other 4 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Be at Peace with Nature on “Half An Acre
* Idyllic natural setting only a minute in your car to Creswick
* So much wildlife to watch and enjoy as time goes by
* Feel the warmth of the solid fuel heater. Cooling too
* Ensuite to master bedroom. Second bathroom is a bonus
* The floorplan showcases two bedrooms and a home office
* Expansive sunroom with the most peaceful views
* Good size kitchen. Gas stove. Plenty of cupboard space
* Shedding for many vehicles,or ideal for the avid hobbyist, or both
* Make me your own private retreat today. A home for life.
* Ideally suited as a weekend retreat on the fringe of Creswick

LAND FOR SALE - DUNACH

Zoned farming and no services connected. Call for details.

Description:
60 glorious grazing acres, 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom home, large machinery shed, 7 paddocks, bore, dam & tank water, just 35 mins to Ballarat.
Words cannot describe this idyllic panoramic setting for this 60 acre grazing farm. The captivating sun rises from behind the rolling hills and the stunning sunsets disappear beyond the striking blue pyrenees mountains. The 4 bedroom, ensuite plus study home consists of a modern kitchen with dishwasher and gas stove, open plan living and meals with split system opens onto a large covered decking area that has captivating views over the native garden and farm to the neighboring rolling hills. The warm and cosy home has a 5kw solar system and is surrounded by a landscaped native garden with quality plants, trees and shrubs complete with an 8 person hot tub is embodied within the garden. The property is fenced into 7 paddocks all with water troughs supplied by bore water. A feature dam is situated in the centre of the farm. The 60 x 30 machinery shed has power and is partly used as a shearing shed and could be easily converted into horse stables, another large shed is fully enclosed for lock away storage. The pasture consisting of rye grass, clover, fescue and a lucerne paddock is currently running 105 breeding ewes and 103 lambs. We have tried to use words to explain this property but it has to be seen to be believed. Just a 35 minute drive from Ballarat and 10 minute drive to Waubra. This desirable property has been priced to sell.
Insights: 232 Retallicks Road, Burnbank VIC 3371 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Superb Home on corner allotment
This well presented 3 bedroom home has all this plus more. 2 carports for under cover parking, plus a DLUG with automatic roller door and an access door to dining room, extremely handy when bringing the groceries home. Inside the home features include: Electric cooktop and wall over, ample cupboard space in the well set out kitchen. Huge living room with natural gas heater with feature tiled mantle piece. All three bedroom have built in robes, master bedroom also with ensuite.
Inspection is a must, you won't be disappointed. To arrange yours today contact Ange Flowers on 0437 456 908 or Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Offering Exceptional Value
Situated amongst some of Regional Victoria’s most historical homes and within the most magnificent tree lined boulevard is this charming two bedroom Miners cottage positioned in the historic township of Kingston, only a 15-minute drive to the popular tourist destination of Daylesford and a quick five minute drive to the township of Creswick.
The property boasts Tasmanian Oak floors in the living area and bedrooms. The kitchen has a spacious work station and fully equipped with stainless steel appliances, gas and electric cooking and is finished with generous timber bench tops. The living area is warmed by a Ned Kelly wood heater enclosed within the original cottage brick fireplace, there is a combination family bathroom and laundry and the master bedroom is furnished with robes.
At the rear of the garden is a wood/storage shed as well as a bungalow/studio. Set on approx. 644m2, this manageable yet still sizable allotment is priced to sell. Offering value for money it provides excellent investment opportunity as it is currently returning $260 a week, or alternatively can be sold with vacant possession.
Inspect to avoid disappointment.
Insights: 364 Kingston Road, Kingston VIC 3364 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Lifestyle, Views and Income - just 20 minutes from Daylesford
Situated on the North-West slopes of Mt. Kooroocheang between Smeaton and Daylesford is this rare offering. The Former Shearing Shed has been converted to an amazing 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home. The "Gun-Barrel" straight hallway leads to stunning 20 m x 7 m open plan Kitchen/Dining/Lounge areas with exposed beams from a by-gone era -Sourced from the Old "Myers Melbourne" Building.These together with the steel wall murals of Rams give an ambiance of the once busy shearing shed. The home is brand New "never lived in "and comes with full owner builders warranty insurance. The Alfresco deck is made from the original grating slats and the home has stunning 180 degree views to the North and West of the surrounding countryside and to the distant Pyrenees ranges and beyond. The Sunsets are spectacular. Water is via two dams. A machinery shed is at the North end of the property. This property has enormous income earning potential as the Land could be leased for $10,000 per annum and the house and 5 acres for approx. $420 per week giving a gross return of $31,840.00 per year. Alternatively you could just lease the land and enjoy a beautiful new home in the country, or run your own Livestock and produce a nice income. The Vendor is prepared to lease back app 120 acres for $1,250 per month for a fixed term of 12/24 months or longer by negotiation should you so desire.

Description:
WELL LOCATED CRESWICK HOME ON DUAL ACCESS BLOCK - SUBDIVISION POTENTIAL
Located in popular Creswick is this well presented home on a massive (approx) 1277 sqm block with stunning garden and boasting lovely rural views. The kitchen area set in a neutral colour scheme has good cupboard space and sits beside the meals area looking over the great outside views. The living area has split system and Rinnai heater plus there are 3 Bedrooms, 2 with BIR's. The block has dual road frontage and has the potential for subdivision with services at the rear of the block and other benefits like NBN, 1.5 Kilowatt solar power system & external blinds. This property really does have it all.

Description:
4+ Acres of Country Lifestyle, Shedding & Spacious Living
This picturesque property is set at Creswick North and is only three minutes back in to the hub of town. An ideal homestead for horses with stables and yards, visitors can also appreciate fruit trees and stunning views. The title is 4 acres of size, but there is also an extremely cheap yearly Gov. lease for a further 2.5 acres. The abode is spacious with vast living areas and very generous bedrooms, with an ensuite to the master. Many forms of heating and cooling bring all year comfort. The residence has young floor coverings, has been recently painted and now displays a beautiful new kitchen which is open plan to lounge and meals area. This zone (via two doorways) leads to the huge 13 meter long decking/pergola area. The shedding and car coverage includes a three car carport, a 9 x 3m garage, a 4 x 3m workshop and other sheds.

Description:
Wonderful Lifestyle Property With Wondrous Shedding
We all want a country and bush aspect, just two minutes to the hub of town. This delivers that lifestyle. A large family home, there is fabulous space inside and out. The abode itself has three large bedrooms, with the master boasting vast space and an ensuite. The study or formal dining is also large enough to utilise as a fourth bedroom. There is a massive central living to the residence ideal for the big entertainers or simply family fun. All year comfort is had with a reverse cycle air-conditioning and wood fire for ambiance. The large allotment grants room for outdoor activities, displays a picturesque gazebo/fernery, BBQ area and great shedding. Two double garages are supplied for the handyman, tradesman or car enthusiast. A tandem carport joins the home.

Description:
'New Horizons" - Rural Conference Centre, Reception & Home
On the Daylesford side of Smeaton lies this unique opportunity set on 14 acres. "New Horizons" was opened in 1988 by the Minister for the Arts. It has hosted many events, conferences, wedding receptions and could easily be utilised by schools and corporations for get-aways. The grand feature of the premises is the octagon hall with cathedral ceiling and almost 360 degree views over countryside. There are 4 guest rooms which each take two beds and have private bathrooms. There is also a separate living/dining room (5.5x9.5m), toilets, storage room and a commercial styled kitchen. There is also a two room care-takers residence. Gardens and BBQ area add to the beauty of the property. The options are only limited to your imagination, but the setting is both unique and stunning.
Insights: 3330 Creswick - Newstead Road, Smeaton VIC 3364 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
OLD GLENDARUEL SCHOOL circa 1880
Located in the heart of the Goldfields, “The Old Glendaruel Primary School” was built around 1880 and operated until the mid-1950’s as a school and teacher’s residence. It was used in the 1970-90’s as a school camp and has recently undergone a fabulous conversion into residential accommodation.
Enjoy the rural atmosphere with long views over the adjacent farming land to Mt Bolton & Mt Beckworth. Only 10 mins to the bustling township of Clunes, 18 mins to Creswick, 25 mins to Ballarat and 35 mins to the Spa centre of Daylesford, this property is not only centrally located but has the school bus running past with a stop at the front gate.
The unique and historic 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom property is situated on 4026m2 (just over 1 acre). Offers magnificent original features including the school room with its double height, mansard ceiling, double sided brick fire place and the original ablution block has been renovated into a unique offering.
• Land size of 4026m2 [1 acre], Zoned Farming
• Bore water, bottled gas, septic waste system, mains power, NBN Internet
• 2 car garage, 2 good size gardening/storage sheds and chicken coop
• Under carpet heating in school room, potbelly wood fire in kitchen/dining area, large Coonara wood fire heater, split system heating/cooling in kitchen
• Dry stone walling on three sides of property
• Established gardens with mature trees and raised garden boxes
Inspections are highly recommended and are offered for Public and Private Inspection by appointment.
Insights: 1337 Coghills Creek Road, Glendaruel VIC 3363 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
AMAZING ACRES - PERFECT POSITION FOR YOUR DREAM HOME (STCA)
Situated just minutes' drive from Talbot this stunning acreage requires your immediate attention. Mostly cleared and zoned farming this could make a great lifestyle change. On the corner of Collings Rd and Dunn Rd this land has gentle undulation to the rear, plenty of higher ground to build (STCA.) and a massive dam. The land has a small treed area in the corner to attract local birdlife but is mostly cleared. Power is passing through the property. 20 acre blocks like this are becoming rare in today's market, so don't delay.
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough office on 0409935766.

Description:
MODERN COUNTRY LIVING
Situated on a large 2449m2 (approx.) block with views of the rolling hills of Newlyn, this modern and well-presented home is located just a 10-minute drive from Daylesford and 25 minutes to Ballarat. Just 4 years old, the house has been skilfully designed for comfortable country living. Ideal for the first home buyer, rental investor or plenty of space for a growing family.
This delightful brick residence features 3 large bedrooms all with BIR, master with WIR and ensuite, DLUG with automatic roller door, entertainer’s kitchen with top of the range appliances, open plan living/dining with an undercover alfresco area overlooking the fully fenced backyard.
-Large 2449m2 (approx) block with rich red soil, Township Zoning (TZ)
-Mains Power, Town Water, Biocycle wastewater treatment system, Bottled gas, NBN Internet
-Split system heating/cooling & fan forced wood heater
-9000L rain water tank plumbed back into toilets
-Walking distance to Primary School and School bus to Ballarat and Daylesford nearby
Inspect by advanced appointment only and highly recommended.

Description:
1.7HA 4.25 Acres Perfectly Positioned For Growth
Well situated 2000 metres South of the historic township of Talbot this 4.25 acre allotment is zoned Rural Living and offers pleasant blend of native pastures, established timber and elevated areas that would make an ideal home-sites (STCA). Recently surveyed and with the convenience private entrance, phone passing and mains power nearby (but not passing) this property offers potential for a dwelling or given its proximity major centres such Ballarat & Maryborough and thriving goldfields townships of Clunes and Talbot, an astute "land-bank" investment.
